lead_paragraph: SIGAL IBSEN--Rose, at 93, passed peacefully on March 29, 2016 in her home in New York City. Rosie was born in Romania, migrated to Israel after World War II and had lived in the United States since 1957. She dedicated her life to art, family and friends. Rosie's career began as a fine jewelry enameler. It wasn't until she was 50 that she began her life as an artist. She developed a broad artistic background which included sumi-e painting and calligraphy. Rosie's art has appeared in many solo and group exhibitions in the United States, Europe and Asia. She used to say "I don't know how I could live without my painting and calligraphy. Rosie was predeceased by her first husband Albert Dov Sigal and her second husband Joe Ibsen. She is survived by her son Daniel Sigal, five grandchildren and their families, as well as nieces, nephews and their children. The Memorial Service will be held on Sunday, April 17, 2016 in the Parlor at Hallmark Senior Living, 455 North End Avenue (between Chambers and Warren Street by the Hudson River), in NYC at 1:30pm. 1/3

headline.main: Paid Notice: Deaths  SIGAL IBSEN, ROSE
